alert.note: Alert for Arthur; Grant; Hooker; Keith; Lincoln; Logan; McPherson; Perkins; Thomas (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 23 at 11:43PM CDT until June 24 at 12:30AM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: The National Weather Service in North Platte has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Arthur County in west central Nebraska... Northeastern Perkins County in southwestern Nebraska... Southeastern Grant County in west central Nebraska... Eastern Keith County in southwestern Nebraska... Southern Hooker County in west central Nebraska... Lincoln County in southwestern Nebraska... Western Logan County in west central Nebraska... McPherson County in west central Nebraska... Southwestern Thomas County in north central Nebraska... * Until 1230 AM CDT/1130 PM MDT/. * At 1143 PM CDT/1043 PM MDT/, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Swan Lake to 14 miles north of Sarben to 9 miles northeast of Elsie, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... North Platte, Tryon, Sutherland, Hershey, Paxton, Maxwell, Swan Lake, Lake Maloney State Recreation Area, Sarben, Ringgold, Sutherland Reservoir State Recreation Area, North Platte Airport, Keith, Cottonwood Canyon State Wildlife Management Area, Flatts, O`Fallons, Cogill Lake, Three Mile Lake, Somerset and Shimmons Lake. This includes the following highways... Highway 92 between mile markers 176 and 227. Highway 97 between mile markers 1 and 49. Interstate 80 in Nebraska between mile markers 144 and 191. Highway 83 between mile markers 60 and 107. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT/midnight MDT/ for southwestern, north central and west central Nebraska. This is a DANGEROUS SITUATION. These storms are producing widespread wind damage across Keith and Arthur counties. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows! A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT/midnight MDT/ for southwestern, north central and west central Nebraska.

area.areaDesc: Arthur; Grant; Hooker; Keith; Lincoln; Logan; McPherson; Perkins; Thomas
